page.title: 04Agriculture
page.content: The area is covered by a drift deposit of Boulder clay, has clay-loam soils and is Grade 2 Agricultural land. There were more mixed farms in this area. Farming policies have transformed the area, several farms have changed completely and arable crops now predominate. Only scattered pasture areas remain such as the Firs, brewery owned land adjacent to the 3 Horseshoes public house and at West End Farm, Kempston. A rotation of barley, rape and 3 wheats are grown in a 5 year cycle. Minimal cultivation methods are used and surplus straw and stubble are burnt after harvesting.
